snippet.textDisplay:
As much as I loved the first Okami, it was far from perfect either. The game was just way too easy and the dungeons were rather dull and linear.  

And why would you buy the same game twice? It makes no sense.

snippet.textDisplay:
Okamiden was just about as epic an adventure as Okami was. I also have to say that Okami wasn't as bad as I figured it'd be on the Wii. It certainly made drawing feel a little more intuitive, but it could also be a little frustrating.

Overall, it's definitely a unique gaming experience, and I loved every moment of it.
snippet.textOriginal:
Okamiden was just about as epic an adventure as Okami was. I also have to say that Okami wasn't as bad as I figured it'd be on the Wii. It certainly made drawing feel a little more intuitive, but it could also be a little frustrating.

Overall, it's definitely a unique gaming experience, and I loved every moment of it.

snippet.textDisplay: Oh yeah - the puzzles were not puzzles, just barriers to progression. No thought involved. That was really disappointing. I share your frustrations, but I blame awkward combat on the DS control scheme being pooly suited for having the touchscreen integrated into gameplay. I also hate DS graphics, but neither of those things I would blame on Okamiden.
snippet.textOriginal: Oh yeah - the puzzles were not puzzles, just barriers to progression. No thought involved. That was really disappointing. I share your frustrations, but I blame awkward combat on the DS control scheme being pooly suited for having the touchscreen integrated into gameplay. I also hate DS graphics, but neither of those things I would blame on Okamiden.

snippet.textDisplay: You're a stronger man than I: as much as I loved Okami, I thought Okamiden sucked the big one, apart from the music.  Combat went from fun to frustrating, dungeons were an endless succession of using your partner instead of any actual thought, and... blegh.

snippet.textDisplay: I liked Okamiden alright. It has most of Okami's same strengths and weaknesses: memorable characters, engaging story, but cutscenes go on and on and on. The framerate issues were nearly a deal-killer for me as well. Better than the Golden Sun sequel, but still a little disappointing.
snippet.textOriginal: I liked Okamiden alright. It has most of Okami's same strengths and weaknesses: memorable characters, engaging story, but cutscenes go on and on and on. The framerate issues were nearly a deal-killer for me as well. Better than the Golden Sun sequel, but still a little disappointing.

snippet.textDisplay: Glad to see the recent activity from you.
snippet.textOriginal: Glad to see the recent activity from you.

snippet.textDisplay:
It's hard not to like Okami, a magical and﻿ beautiful adventure with a unique heroine, awesome music and gameplay. Thanks to its brush style graphics, it's a game that also aged very well. If you have a PS3 and never played this game, I couldn't recommend Okami HD enough when it comes out.

And sure, I'd love to get a full sequel on consoles someday, but I'm one of the people who loved Okamiden on the DS. One of my﻿ favorite games﻿ for the system.
snippet.textOriginal:
It's hard not to like Okami, a magical and﻿ beautiful adventure with a unique heroine, awesome music and gameplay. Thanks to its brush style graphics, it's a game that also aged very well. If you have a PS3 and never played this game, I couldn't recommend Okami HD enough when it comes out.

And sure, I'd love to get a full sequel on consoles someday, but I'm one of the people who loved Okamiden on the DS. One of my﻿ favorite games﻿ for the system.
